abstract: William E Rapfogel, onetime Jewish community leader serving up to 10 years in prison for role in stealing $9 million from Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty, is transferred to work-release program in Manhattan less than two years into his sentence.
lead_paragraph: William E. Rapfogel, the former chief executive and executive director of the Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty, had admitted to stealing more than $1 million from his own charity.

headline.main: Charity’s Onetime Leader Begins a Work-Release Program
headline.print_headline: Charity’s Onetime Leader Begins a Work-Release Program

snippet: William E. Rapfogel, the former chief executive and executive director of the Metropolitan Council on Jewish Poverty, had admitted to stealing more than $1 million from his own charity.
